medical_history.chief_complaint: Abnormal fetal karyotype in a 32-year-old pregnant woman at 17 weeks of gestation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had an uneventful first trimester. In the 14th week, an ultrasound performed for an ovarian cyst revealed a normal fetus but with increased nuchal translucency (3.7 mm, normal ≤2.5 mm). Follow-up ultrasound at 16 weeks showed bilateral nuchal hygromas, and amniocentesis revealed a karyotype of 46,XY, add(18)(p11.2).
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previous ovarian cysts, including a clear cyst and an endometrioma, but no chronic illnesses or surgeries specified.
medical_history.family_history: The mother’s paternal aunt had two sons with birth defects. Other relatives were reported healthy.
medical_history.social_history: The mother smoked in the past but stopped before conception; she consumed 2-3 alcoholic beverages per week but ceased drinking upon learning of her pregnancy.
